meanings.definition: A small pin or rod used as a fastener
meanings.sent1: I used a toggle to secure the papers together.
meanings.sent2: The toggle on my jacket broke, so I couldn't close it properly.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel tried to hide the acorn with a toggle.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter was like a toggle, bringing joy to everyone around.
meanings.sent5: The shiny toggle gleamed in the sunlight, catching my eye.

meanings.definition: A switch or lever that can be moved back and forth to turn a device on or off
meanings.sent1: I flicked the toggle to turn on the lights in the room.
meanings.sent2: The toggle on the machine was stuck, so it wouldn't start.
meanings.sent3: The cat played with the toggle, thinking it was a toy.
meanings.sent4: His decision was like a toggle, constantly changing back and forth.
meanings.sent5: She reached for the toggle, eager to see the magic happen.

meanings.definition: To switch between two options or settings by pressing a button or moving a switch
meanings.sent1: I had to toggle between the two modes to find the right one.
meanings.sent2: She toggled the settings on her phone to adjust the brightness.
meanings.sent3: The robot seemed confused as it tried to toggle between tasks.
meanings.sent4: His mood would toggle like a light switch, unpredictable and sudden.
meanings.sent5: The athlete had to quickly toggle between offense and defense during the game.
